Heroku

# 

<span key="95d4757654b3470780caf71d58a0fade"><span offset-key="95d4757654b3470780caf71d58a0fade:0">Heroku</span></span>

## 

<span key="1b5ed0d9f8e54cfab8d886f59214ee4b"><span offset-key="1b5ed0d9f8e54cfab8d886f59214ee4b:0">(HE-100) Naming Standards</span></span>

<span key="d9d456bd759642ac930f2c0a482c3943"><span offset-key="d9d456bd759642ac930f2c0a482c3943:0">The following naming standards apply to all apps in Heroku:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="4036257070344fc79852aa81b884139e"><span offset-key="4036257070344fc79852aa81b884139e:0">The name of the Heroku App must match the repository name</span></span>

<span key="6e40cdcab53d400e967faeacf7c102f6"><span offset-key="6e40cdcab53d400e967faeacf7c102f6:0">Rationale:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="fcbfaf5614d24188ad49fbac979645d1"><span offset-key="fcbfaf5614d24188ad49fbac979645d1:0">Naming conventions are crucial for managing the large number of different applications we support</span></span>

<span key="2a0dbcf967724db4b96b86b2e8f6d80a"><span offset-key="2a0dbcf967724db4b96b86b2e8f6d80a:0">Alternatives:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="9365167bdab24ae395d841356c9d5ae8"><span offset-key="9365167bdab24ae395d841356c9d5ae8:0">None</span></span>

<span key="53041fd807cc433486eee9790de086d7"><span offset-key="53041fd807cc433486eee9790de086d7:0">Exceptions:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="c2bae95cde0547f9abf16ac282e6e437"><span offset-key="c2bae95cde0547f9abf16ac282e6e437:0">None</span></span>

<span key="fe4510cabe384c45ad3b1e7bd18721cd"><span offset-key="fe4510cabe384c45ad3b1e7bd18721cd:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><a href="https://docs.labs.lambdaschool.com/standards/infrastructure/aws" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c93c0dfb16ef413b854530254ee72e13" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-49131_259-49132-237__"><span data-key="271bd07b276949f4bf40ab5f6f84186d"><span data-offset-key="271bd07b276949f4bf40ab5f6f84186d:0"> </span></span></span></a><span key="b4e1a9bab8474881a612ef315a42e055"><span offset-key="b4e1a9bab8474881a612ef315a42e055:0">Heroku Basics</span></span>

<span key="200a9a97478b42f18a0da78d5a997843"><span offset-key="200a9a97478b42f18a0da78d5a997843:0">â€‹</span></span><a href="https://docs.labs.lambdaschool.com/guides/always-read-this-first" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a70291f48c11400bad8f0b9d3746c5f9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-49131_259-49132-237__"><span data-key="1e2d1cc43f5a47528c0d71f82d6f4ebd"><span data-offset-key="1e2d1cc43f5a47528c0d71f82d6f4ebd:0">Please read this first!!</span></span></span></a><span key="47a284a7ce334392812f051f7ff5fc8b"><span offset-key="47a284a7ce334392812f051f7ff5fc8b:0">â€‹</span></span>

# 

<span key="9a74c45365574d80b286e95dd329d531"><span offset-key="9a74c45365574d80b286e95dd329d531:0">SSL</span></span>

<span key="1ac82f1d0f174e54932b6cefdec594fa"><span offset-key="1ac82f1d0f174e54932b6cefdec594fa:0">Enabling SSL is as easy as switching it on in the settings tab.</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="44d5767ff70b48a9877f3a6ea39c86c3"><span offset-key="44d5767ff70b48a9877f3a6ea39c86c3:0">Click Configure SSL</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="cfa2532408c5426bb6d8fb7ba094d7e4"><span offset-key="cfa2532408c5426bb6d8fb7ba094d7e4:0">Choose Automatic Certificate Management (ACM)</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="bb1c2dfa3c8f4a5eafcfdd2080982c2e"><span offset-key="bb1c2dfa3c8f4a5eafcfdd2080982c2e:0">Done</span></span>

# 

<span key="796bfd24af7c4d22a55dd316145bacc6"><span offset-key="796bfd24af7c4d22a55dd316145bacc6:0">FAQ</span></span>

## 

<span key="57aa1a1bb4c04a358332acffad0efd79"><span offset-key="57aa1a1bb4c04a358332acffad0efd79:0">How do we get a new or existing Heroku account?</span></span>

<span key="8c6cd325be22463e989a7e199d128b4e"><span offset-key="8c6cd325be22463e989a7e199d128b4e:0">Your APL will provide your team access to a Heroku application as needed in a Lambda School managed Heroku account</span></span>

# 

<span key="bbe6750ba27e4b0f9ff20c10a718be91"><span offset-key="bbe6750ba27e4b0f9ff20c10a718be91:0">Heroku Node Deployment</span></span>

<span key="3dec62a94ec84f4e841a5228dd157705"><span offset-key="3dec62a94ec84f4e841a5228dd157705:0">Heroku</span></span>

<span key="4d65c3f401bf48feb9922ee0d6db9848"><span offset-key="4d65c3f401bf48feb9922ee0d6db9848:0">As </span>`Associate Product Lead`<span offset-key="4d65c3f401bf48feb9922ee0d6db9848:2"> and </span>`Technical Project Leads`<span offset-key="4d65c3f401bf48feb9922ee0d6db9848:4"> you'll be responsible for provisioning Heroku accounts for your students, configuring the applications to use a </span>`Postgres`<span offset-key="4d65c3f401bf48feb9922ee0d6db9848:6"> addon, and granting access to the provisioned app to the students who need it (should be WEB students primarily).</span></span>

<span key="6af69a2b6ce24877a029465a8deaadd5"><span offset-key="6af69a2b6ce24877a029465a8deaadd5:0">Currently only APLs will have full admin access to apps.</span></span>

<span key="d66c1f5619d541ebb7d51b0f93a5fb3f"><span offset-key="d66c1f5619d541ebb7d51b0f93a5fb3f:0">There are some settings any team member can perform, eg. </span>`Environment Variables`</span>

# 

<span key="14d1488708974c2e94b86ea0f6df2652"><span offset-key="14d1488708974c2e94b86ea0f6df2652:0">Steps to setting up and provisioning Heroku apps - APLs</span></span>

<span key="a9c144623810473aa941bcb6369ef77d"><span offset-key="a9c144623810473aa941bcb6369ef77d:0">If you haven't gotten admin access to Heroku yet please ask you engineering manager to set that up using your </span>`Lambda School Student Email`<span offset-key="a9c144623810473aa941bcb6369ef77d:2"> (@lambdastudents.com)</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="5cbd4d380ae14b558a7f399ea158733f"><span offset-key="5cbd4d380ae14b558a7f399ea158733f:0">Log into the Heroku console using your Lambda issued student email.</span></span>

    <span key="32211fcee0ac468e9e1db53b57f7106f">*You should have received access to the console from your engineering manager.*</span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="f49527470f8e4512978e00699a3719a3"><span offset-key="f49527470f8e4512978e00699a3719a3:0">Click on the </span>`New`<span offset-key="f49527470f8e4512978e00699a3719a3:2"> button in the top right corner</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="21b21f1585ee4503a668f69ed944fa0a"><span offset-key="21b21f1585ee4503a668f69ed944fa0a:0">Name the app using our Labs naming convention: </span>`productname-team-api`<span offset-key="21b21f1585ee4503a668f69ed944fa0a:2"> i.e.</span></span>

    <span key="9b84613cd67f401e8884bec1f182df8a">`ecosoap-a-api`</span>

## 

<span key="1387b79ad594436980fc3cb0eec2df00"><span offset-key="1387b79ad594436980fc3cb0eec2df00:0">Configuring the </span>`PostgresQL`<span offset-key="1387b79ad594436980fc3cb0eec2df00:2"> add-on - APLs</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="421f023da42b4b0fa17bdee3c38ba1f5"><span offset-key="421f023da42b4b0fa17bdee3c38ba1f5:0">Select the app and click on </span>`Overview`</span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="5c721a97282f4cdcad0d895bf25b607f"><span offset-key="5c721a97282f4cdcad0d895bf25b607f:0">Select </span>`Configure Add-ons`</span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="207245813c2b41b583ba28784e8c0e30"><span offset-key="207245813c2b41b583ba28784e8c0e30:0">Search for </span>`Postgres`<span offset-key="207245813c2b41b583ba28784e8c0e30:2"> and </span>`Heroku Postgres`<span offset-key="207245813c2b41b583ba28784e8c0e30:4"> should appear in the list of options</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="772cbc6239e34a538b0f7370e1454eab"><span offset-key="772cbc6239e34a538b0f7370e1454eab:0">Select </span>`Heroku Postgres`<span offset-key="772cbc6239e34a538b0f7370e1454eab:2"> and select -> </span>`Hobby Basic - $9.00`</span>

5.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">5.</span>
    <span key="f47b2784209342a489c5e3fbbce93ece"><span offset-key="f47b2784209342a489c5e3fbbce93ece:0">Select </span>`Provision`</span>

## 

<span key="823ecf8094dc4a738a9fcca5149e611e"><span offset-key="823ecf8094dc4a738a9fcca5149e611e:0">Adding Members to the provisioned app - APLs</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="e1f08d53e4ae452bb5e4c8699c7a6c1a"><span offset-key="e1f08d53e4ae452bb5e4c8699c7a6c1a:0">Once the app is created click on the app and select the </span>`access`<span offset-key="e1f08d53e4ae452bb5e4c8699c7a6c1a:2"> tab</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="9e9ea97a076f4d16855998b11712f16d"><span offset-key="9e9ea97a076f4d16855998b11712f16d:0">Click </span>`Add Member`<span offset-key="9e9ea97a076f4d16855998b11712f16d:2"> and add your students (please use their lambda issued emails) and TPL to the app as making sure that </span>`View`<span offset-key="9e9ea97a076f4d16855998b11712f16d:4">, </span>`Deploy`<span offset-key="9e9ea97a076f4d16855998b11712f16d:6">, </span>`Operate`<span offset-key="9e9ea97a076f4d16855998b11712f16d:8"> boxes are all selected. Click </span>`Save Changes`</span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="96139db228f94cf1b50b91c1333d6b36"><span offset-key="96139db228f94cf1b50b91c1333d6b36:0">Your students should receive an email granting them access to their console; follow up and make sure they are able to get in</span></span>

<span key="a31afecb07854968a0574fe3aac5a260">*Note: For build-ons, you'll be adding students to an existing Heroku app.*</span>

## 

<span key="b69bfd81bd0d41449e9a336d4373442e"><span offset-key="b69bfd81bd0d41449e9a336d4373442e:0">Environment Variables - Any team member with access</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="7983635c36574ec9a9458362578f1082"><span offset-key="7983635c36574ec9a9458362578f1082:0">From the application tab navigation select </span>`Settings`</span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="e9ea94c3398244b2ae23db3a96e84ee0"><span offset-key="e9ea94c3398244b2ae23db3a96e84ee0:0">Select </span>`Reveal Config Vars`</span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="1ff5285eeb0f4f6192d4cf49aa0b2995"><span offset-key="1ff5285eeb0f4f6192d4cf49aa0b2995:0">\*\*You should already see a </span>`DATABASE_URL`<span offset-key="1ff5285eeb0f4f6192d4cf49aa0b2995:2"> assigned to the postgres add-on you</span></span>

    <span key="0d61745875e644f8b441f6f1bb6bd36f"><span offset-key="0d61745875e644f8b441f6f1bb6bd36f:0">set up\*\*</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="cf45a00192b34a4cb04c2eb67ff1c754"><span offset-key="cf45a00192b34a4cb04c2eb67ff1c754:0">Add all the proper environment variables</span></span>

## 

<span key="51cc8762811c402bb364de3f437b5d12"><span offset-key="51cc8762811c402bb364de3f437b5d12:0">Deployment - APLs</span></span>

### 

<span key="d47398a0cf294350b16cc8d06b094232"><span offset-key="d47398a0cf294350b16cc8d06b094232:0">Setup</span></span>

<span key="44b458b7f8e84e2f9018c590cf09171c"><span offset-key="44b458b7f8e84e2f9018c590cf09171c:0">Connect github</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="06a5d9c54fa744da828125911d46b410"><span offset-key="06a5d9c54fa744da828125911d46b410:0">From the application tab navigation select </span>`Deploy`</span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="f43fd3a5df0d44ef8c946ec0147fcf48"><span offset-key="f43fd3a5df0d44ef8c946ec0147fcf48:0">Select the </span>`GitHub`<span offset-key="f43fd3a5df0d44ef8c946ec0147fcf48:2"> "Deployment Method"</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="36a231bb7c314da8a710ea47786c4e76"><span offset-key="36a231bb7c314da8a710ea47786c4e76:0">Find the </span>`Connect to GitHub`<span offset-key="36a231bb7c314da8a710ea47786c4e76:2"> section and select </span>`Lambda-School-Labs`</span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="3e53e097fc504e29adabf951a488e96f"><span offset-key="3e53e097fc504e29adabf951a488e96f:0">Find your app and select </span>`Connect`</span>

5.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">5.</span>
    <span key="64a3985c80a94d44b404457307745f7a"><span offset-key="64a3985c80a94d44b404457307745f7a:0">Deploy from the </span>`main`<span offset-key="64a3985c80a94d44b404457307745f7a:2"> branch</span></span>

6.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">6.</span>
    <span key="5d6a56a804d6400b9d9348c8e6e8e9b5"><span offset-key="5d6a56a804d6400b9d9348c8e6e8e9b5:0">Select </span>`Wait for CI to pass before deploy`</span>

7.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">7.</span>
    <span key="ace3da2daea447449f199c8909020284">`Enable Automatic Deploys`<span offset-key="ace3da2daea447449f199c8909020284:1"> so that anytime a branch is merged into main</span></span>

<span key="b89bc42104eb4d3e97a4c85cf79f73ac"><span offset-key="b89bc42104eb4d3e97a4c85cf79f73ac:0">connect repo</span></span>

### 

<span key="13fc0980e90f446fb630359844f62b7b"><span offset-key="13fc0980e90f446fb630359844f62b7b:0">First Deploy</span></span>

<span key="ba02823b414347d88dfc41e5e84bcc19"><span offset-key="ba02823b414347d88dfc41e5e84bcc19:0">There are 2 conditions where Heroku will likely not automatically deploy the app right after setup:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="7284ce05c13a49f3bf1992e809b97ca8"><span offset-key="7284ce05c13a49f3bf1992e809b97ca8:0">The events </span>`push`<span offset-key="7284ce05c13a49f3bf1992e809b97ca8:2"> for the main branch and </span>`ci_complete`<span offset-key="7284ce05c13a49f3bf1992e809b97ca8:4"> haven't triggered</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="3589c81a32f94a3dbf823d970ccb4430"><span offset-key="3589c81a32f94a3dbf823d970ccb4430:0">There is no code in the repo yet ðŸ˜¬ðŸ˜‚</span></span>

<span key="0354b7e7590c474a8ca167eeb97f503e"><span offset-key="0354b7e7590c474a8ca167eeb97f503e:0">When your repo is ready follow these steps to complete the deploy.</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="296f36f9438642b19b64decb2f2d1492"><span offset-key="296f36f9438642b19b64decb2f2d1492:0">run a manual deploy by hitting the </span>`Deploy Branch`<span offset-key="296f36f9438642b19b64decb2f2d1492:2"> button at the bottom of</span></span>

    <span key="c04d996e1bb046b7bad76722bf7119cd"><span offset-key="c04d996e1bb046b7bad76722bf7119cd:0">the page</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="2b9f042c8c3f4f0ab5e61d701dcae215"><span offset-key="2b9f042c8c3f4f0ab5e61d701dcae215:0">Click </span>`Open app`<span offset-key="2b9f042c8c3f4f0ab5e61d701dcae215:2">; you will see the </span>`"api":"up"`<span offset-key="2b9f042c8c3f4f0ab5e61d701dcae215:4"> message if all is well.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="19184fbfb39b465c8d3d658e094efb66"><span offset-key="19184fbfb39b465c8d3d658e094efb66:0">Using the heroku console run the following commands (Alternatively you</span></span>

    <span key="dc1985f278874dceae214a8a5731c2e6"><span offset-key="dc1985f278874dceae214a8a5731c2e6:0">can use the heroku cli app)</span></span>

    1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
        <span key="00b00f4396be40539cbcbbfa54ca80c9">`bash`<span offset-key="00b00f4396be40539cbcbbfa54ca80c9:1"> then you can run the following commands from the shell</span></span>

    2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
        <span key="1a74a744d27e41ad884fb3c7a3bf36ea">`npm run knex migrate:latest`</span>

    3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
        <span key="0cb6253f95e747e182e1c5fa25e7b1d0">`npm run knex seed:run`<span offset-key="0cb6253f95e747e182e1c5fa25e7b1d0:1"> this is optional if the team wants to start with</span></span>

        <span key="30bfbd9450e741d6af3c27e0a4518a8f"><span offset-key="30bfbd9450e741d6af3c27e0a4518a8f:0">5 profiles.</span></span>

â€‹

â€‹

<span key="bc71e942fad64c7f94356af645247c2a"><span offset-key="bc71e942fad64c7f94356af645247c2a:0">â€‹â€‹</span></span>

<span key="3bf9577618ad407f861dcbf93e1c7913"><span offset-key="3bf9577618ad407f861dcbf93e1c7913:0">â€‹â€‹</span></span>

<span key="f93f172551654d6ea837bddfadeae3d9"><span offset-key="f93f172551654d6ea837bddfadeae3d9:0">run console</span></span>

<span key="c68d54d014704fb7b6124715631c5a7c"><span offset-key="c68d54d014704fb7b6124715631c5a7c:0">console bash</span></span>

<span key="32a8526548e64e60a39a3c0a2c26ae47">**Your team is now set up! Now when someone has a PR merged into**<span offset-key="32a8526548e64e60a39a3c0a2c26ae47:1"> </span>**`main`**<span offset-key="32a8526548e64e60a39a3c0a2c26ae47:3"> </span>**your team's app will update across the world wide web**</span>

## 

<span key="5b558bea9236491c9122d0a12b58e7f3"><span offset-key="5b558bea9236491c9122d0a12b58e7f3:0">Next Steps</span></span>

<span key="b37b3bd2d91946d49dbac1666245ac4d"><span offset-key="b37b3bd2d91946d49dbac1666245ac4d:0">Checkout how to </span></span><a href="https://github.com/Lambda-School-Labs/gitbook-labs-guides/tree/f514baf6b1b0c2764cc2bce1739043d8ef763b96/heroku/heroku/review-apps/README.md" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8fec90fc72df47f6ae55975cb5b383fc" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-49131_259-49132-237__"><span data-key="14219a9ef10644feb82adf94c6bc51f7"><span data-offset-key="14219a9ef10644feb82adf94c6bc51f7:0">setup Review Apps</span></span></span></a><span key="1d1712fa911f4f778d62208ccead33de"><span offset-key="1d1712fa911f4f778d62208ccead33de:0"> to have Heroku automatically deploy your app for each github PR that you create.</span></span>

<span key="2e7c06a7ca3c4940a721def1336a0321"><span offset-key="2e7c06a7ca3c4940a721def1336a0321:0">Optionally, See the </span></span><a href="https://github.com/Lambda-School-Labs/gitbook-labs-guides/tree/f514baf6b1b0c2764cc2bce1739043d8ef763b96/heroku/heroku/heroku-custom-domain/README.md" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="2247ccf6892b418e8e400ba60b0df5b5" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-49131_259-49132-237__"><span data-key="0397e2d4ab75459c908b04b83b9d3d89"><span data-offset-key="0397e2d4ab75459c908b04b83b9d3d89:0">setting up a Custom Domain Guide</span></span></span></a><span key="842453574add47ce89f6abb30cde6d84"><span offset-key="842453574add47ce89f6abb30cde6d84:0"> to make sure that your API doesn't have the ugly </span>`herokuapp`<span offset-key="842453574add47ce89f6abb30cde6d84:2"> in it's URL.</span></span>

# 

<span key="02979f32c4494ce3a41fad23bfe9dd42"><span offset-key="02979f32c4494ce3a41fad23bfe9dd42:0">Heroku Networking</span></span>

<span key="fb4ea1e89fd74969bf3cdc6681b8a9d0"><span offset-key="fb4ea1e89fd74969bf3cdc6681b8a9d0:0">By default, Heroku creates an endpoint for your application like this:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="fbda58159cdb4774be59293aa11c9557">`https://bridges-a-api.herokuapp.com/`</span>

<span key="9afa6d16a49a443b803f5ada22e9e4a2"><span offset-key="9afa6d16a49a443b803f5ada22e9e4a2:0">This is okay, but if you want to use your custom product domain (e.g. </span>`a-api.bridgestoprosperity.dev`<span offset-key="9afa6d16a49a443b803f5ada22e9e4a2:2">) for your API, you can do this using Route 53.</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="6652476101a741a385e0caaf3fd0fb54"><span offset-key="6652476101a741a385e0caaf3fd0fb54:0">In your Heroku application settings, click Add Domain</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="5cacc15c0e694f68aedd3071838d9db9"><span offset-key="5cacc15c0e694f68aedd3071838d9db9:0">Your domain name will be a subdomain of your product domain, following the </span></span><a href="https://docs.labs.lambdaschool.com/standards/infrastructure/dns#dns-200-product-subdomains" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d97563f2c3324d7baccb0ab9e72539ce" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-49131_259-49132-237__"><span data-key="ed52c70ed0c440c891a00ba0479ebb7a"><span data-offset-key="ed52c70ed0c440c891a00ba0479ebb7a:0">naming standards</span></span></span></a><span key="725628167e674bbe80557fb50823e980"><span offset-key="725628167e674bbe80557fb50823e980:0">. For example, if your product domain is </span>`bridgestoprosperity.dev`<span offset-key="725628167e674bbe80557fb50823e980:2"> and your team letter is 'a', your API domain will be </span>`a-api.bridgestoprosperity.dev`</span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="66572d92b99e415f8a39b5109821c9d5"><span offset-key="66572d92b99e415f8a39b5109821c9d5:0">Heroku will now issue you a specially generated domain to link traffic to your API subdomain</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="c446e3cce60a41148406a760bc7a20f3"><span offset-key="c446e3cce60a41148406a760bc7a20f3:0">Open Route 53 in your AWS account</span></span>

5.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">5.</span>
    <span key="c109953c4f9e463797eef07a187608f5"><span offset-key="c109953c4f9e463797eef07a187608f5:0">Open the hosted zone for your product</span></span>

6.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">6.</span>
    <span key="f6bb3c147c4f4e11ad82cdbbb2586e44"><span offset-key="f6bb3c147c4f4e11ad82cdbbb2586e44:0">Click Create Record</span></span>

7.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">7.</span>
    <span key="35e36ae3681e4abba47b998d5782a4f6"><span offset-key="35e36ae3681e4abba47b998d5782a4f6:0">Simple Routing</span></span>

8.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">8.</span>
    <span key="131cfe7d90774bb7bc38323e024b8114"><span offset-key="131cfe7d90774bb7bc38323e024b8114:0">Define simple record</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

        <span key="417bb0fe848741048d99372172b34855"><span offset-key="417bb0fe848741048d99372172b34855:0">Record name: Your API domain (e.g. </span>`a-api)`</span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

        <span key="b65020fa46a84605a965402ce7f982e4"><span offset-key="b65020fa46a84605a965402ce7f982e4:0">Route traffic to: IP address or another value</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

        <span key="a1f0b1bd6aa547e885f59b7ef373fbd5"><span offset-key="a1f0b1bd6aa547e885f59b7ef373fbd5:0">Value: The generated name from Heroku (e.g. </span>`concentric-turtle-7byvtq3pnb7n316b8zeu6peq.herokudns.com`<span offset-key="a1f0b1bd6aa547e885f59b7ef373fbd5:2">)</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

        <span key="30f4a94cb4244eb998917120251cc1ee"><span offset-key="30f4a94cb4244eb998917120251cc1ee:0">Record type: CNAME</span></span>

9.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">9.</span>
    <span key="33d38142be3043d1a54a573552fe8b33"><span offset-key="33d38142be3043d1a54a573552fe8b33:0">Define simple record</span></span>

10. <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">10.</span>
    <span key="00692ba6973e4c9f854dc0054d3b3205"><span offset-key="00692ba6973e4c9f854dc0054d3b3205:0">Create records</span></span>

11. <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">11.</span>
    <span key="40ef6e1002db495793cb4fe38c7a98b0"><span offset-key="40ef6e1002db495793cb4fe38c7a98b0:0">Now you may need to wait a while for the internet DNS system to catch up</span></span>

12. <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">12.</span>
    <span key="3badc3d79a04435b929fe90315208b0f"><span offset-key="3badc3d79a04435b929fe90315208b0f:0">But once it does, you can now hit your Heroku app using </span>`a-api.bridgestoprosperity.dev`</span>

13. <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">13.</span>
    <span key="7d0edcc42028438ea937eb10988d80c3"><span offset-key="7d0edcc42028438ea937eb10988d80c3:0">Done!</span></span>

# 

<span key="a4d22762ddb94fbeaf7d94cfb2aaf635"><span offset-key="a4d22762ddb94fbeaf7d94cfb2aaf635:0">Heroku Pipelines</span></span>

<span key="46c171e25f384fd5af0a0adad9487f68"><span offset-key="46c171e25f384fd5af0a0adad9487f68:0">Heroku is an amazing hosting platform for any project. Today, I spun up an app to show you how easy it is to set up a Heroku pipeline connected to a GitHub repository and have your project, front or back end, deployed in minutes with a wonderful staging environment set up.</span></span>

<span key="aed237ca090c4c359c3e17db0e251153"><span offset-key="aed237ca090c4c359c3e17db0e251153:0">Having a good staging environment set up can save you from accidentally running production. Trust me, I've been there. Thankfully you don't have to be a tech wizard to set up your project the right way. Setting up a pipeline for your project is as easy as hosting it. So, without further ado, let's dig in.</span></span>

#

    <span key="92cb7144e3474c72834febcf19720fc1"><span offset-key="92cb7144e3474c72834febcf19720fc1:0">â€‹</span></span><a href="https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/pipelines" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="31ef2bc1a2b54f36923f570a2fe5efdd" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-49131_259-49132-237__"><span data-key="068bd4722e1341b9b0dab3051b0c04c8"><span data-offset-key="068bd4722e1341b9b0dab3051b0c04c8:0">Heroku Pipeline</span></span></span></a><span key="674009cc5c85489a9a9300262e66af5e"><span offset-key="674009cc5c85489a9a9300262e66af5e:0">â€‹</span></span>

<span key="fb0e8623c3324b2ca14cf5510ddd21f8"><span offset-key="fb0e8623c3324b2ca14cf5510ddd21f8:0">References</span></span>

<span key="de75813151474f2c87a6684edbfe20d6"><span offset-key="de75813151474f2c87a6684edbfe20d6:0">In addition to the links above, you can watch a </span></span><a href="https://youtu.be/nlBBAdkUEO4" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="60383b3f4e414a2d959c37aec5b0c849" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-49131_259-49132-237__"><span data-key="43d7503845ed4a3da5b15462eebc04da"><span data-offset-key="43d7503845ed4a3da5b15462eebc04da:0">full video walk through here.</span></span></span></a><span key="fa8509c685994faa9ed06f3e5aed8a19"><span offset-key="fa8509c685994faa9ed06f3e5aed8a19:0">.</span></span>

<span key="0bf9457306694399b5c4c8c39108537c">**Step 1**</span>

<span key="210d6aecb649416190e3f1b2e3a1f1b0"><span offset-key="210d6aecb649416190e3f1b2e3a1f1b0:0">Heroku uses </span>`npm start`<span offset-key="210d6aecb649416190e3f1b2e3a1f1b0:2"> to deploy your JavaScript projects. You can change and edit your Heroku dynos (the thing that runs </span>`npm start`<span offset-key="210d6aecb649416190e3f1b2e3a1f1b0:4"> on your project) if you want... for money!for money</span></span>

<span key="4635894b104d4a968ac9e333498712cb"><span offset-key="4635894b104d4a968ac9e333498712cb:0">React projects are usually good to go out of the box. For back end projects you want to be passing your port number as an env variable so heroku can serve it on it's own port.</span></span>

1

<span key="23f0c7410ea7443d8c0d2de7893c5762"><span offset-key="23f0c7410ea7443d8c0d2de7893c5762:0">app.listen(process.env.PORT || "4000", () => { console.log("Running on ${process.env.PORT || "4000"}!\`)}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

<span key="b232f79435084002bfacb67532850a0f"><span offset-key="b232f79435084002bfacb67532850a0f:0">One last tip for making sure you have a successful hosting experience is to make sure you have either a package-lock.json or a yarn.lock, but never both. When you npm install packages it creates a package-lock.json and when you yarn install you get a yarn.lock. If you have both files then heroku won't know what to do and freak out.freaking out</span></span>

<span key="681bc00da1e648b19e2dea08fa5b7160"><span offset-key="681bc00da1e648b19e2dea08fa5b7160:0">One solution that can be particularly useful when working in a group project is adding the one your not going to be using to your .gitignore. So if you are using yarn, add </span>`package-lock.json`<span offset-key="681bc00da1e648b19e2dea08fa5b7160:2"> to your .gitignore and if you're using npm, add </span>`yarn.lock`<span offset-key="681bc00da1e648b19e2dea08fa5b7160:4">. Once all of those things and good to go, your ready to make the magic happen!magic</span></span>

<span key="24b074b22939470d990485b012746345">**Step 2**</span>

<span key="0193e08756c14d36bcedf6367870491c"><span offset-key="0193e08756c14d36bcedf6367870491c:0">We are going to go to our heroku dashboard, where we can see all of our projects and click on new &gt; create new pipeline.create new pipeline</span></span>

<span key="e25bbb51f6a44c229b1fba2ecd3d1a40"><span offset-key="e25bbb51f6a44c229b1fba2ecd3d1a40:0">Then we can give our pipeline a name and connect it to our repository. In my case, I'm going to choose the repository I created named </span>`next-app`<span offset-key="e25bbb51f6a44c229b1fba2ecd3d1a40:2">. Once you have done that, we can click on </span>`Create pipeline`<span offset-key="e25bbb51f6a44c229b1fba2ecd3d1a40:4">.set up pipeline</span></span>

<span key="860f7cfd175541b8b7833b157c734a03"><span offset-key="860f7cfd175541b8b7833b157c734a03:0">Once you have created your pipeline, you will see a page with three sections: review apps, staging, production.pipeline</span></span>

<span key="77bda99a4e2448a0bf3986328f1ea95f"><span offset-key="77bda99a4e2448a0bf3986328f1ea95f:0">In the staging section, click </span>`Add app`<span offset-key="77bda99a4e2448a0bf3986328f1ea95f:2"> then </span>`Create new app...`<span offset-key="77bda99a4e2448a0bf3986328f1ea95f:4">.create staging app</span></span>

<span key="472e6c4a663142d4b4cf0925b94f9c27"><span offset-key="472e6c4a663142d4b4cf0925b94f9c27:0">Name you staging app. I named mine </span>`next-app-stage`<span offset-key="472e6c4a663142d4b4cf0925b94f9c27:2">. You're going to have multiple URLs in your staging to production set up, so it's good to reflect that in how you name them. Once you have your app named and have the appropriate region selected (I live in USA, so I keep it default), click on </span>`Create app`<span offset-key="472e6c4a663142d4b4cf0925b94f9c27:4"> at the bottom. Now we can see our </span>`next-app-stage`<span offset-key="472e6c4a663142d4b4cf0925b94f9c27:6"> app hanging out in the stage tab. Let's click on that app. Once we are viewing that app we just created, we can click on the deploy tag and see that Heroku has already taken the liberty of connecting our repository to the app.deploy tab</span></span>

<span key="cf1941ae531b4841ac551e518d9f60df">**Step 3**</span>

<span key="51f1cf244a1a44558088e35a726996fa"><span offset-key="51f1cf244a1a44558088e35a726996fa:0">Now if our project has any env variables we want to set those fist. Click on </span>`settings`<span offset-key="51f1cf244a1a44558088e35a726996fa:2"> &gt; </span>`Reveal config vars`<span offset-key="51f1cf244a1a44558088e35a726996fa:4"> to do so. My project does not have any env variables to add, so I'm just going to scroll down and click </span>`Enable Automatic Deploys`<span offset-key="51f1cf244a1a44558088e35a726996fa:6"> then on </span>`Deploy Branch`<span offset-key="51f1cf244a1a44558088e35a726996fa:8">. Mine is set up to master branch, which is perfect.deployed app</span></span>

<span key="92a3c441d1c94bee990677c69b945d1f"><span offset-key="92a3c441d1c94bee990677c69b945d1f:0">My app was successfully deployed on the first go, I can click on the </span>`view`<span offset-key="92a3c441d1c94bee990677c69b945d1f:2"> button and see that my next app is up and running! ðŸŽ‰next staging app</span></span>

<span key="5810b033454f4d17b06e35115a3c1096"><span offset-key="5810b033454f4d17b06e35115a3c1096:0">Sweet! So far, so good. Now, since everything looks great, we can create our production app and push our changes to production. Woo hoo!</span></span>

<span key="9ca5378361774ae98f9255daaeabd942"><span offset-key="9ca5378361774ae98f9255daaeabd942:0">We can go back to our pipeline, click </span>`Add app`<span offset-key="9ca5378361774ae98f9255daaeabd942:2"> and then </span>`Create new app...`<span offset-key="9ca5378361774ae98f9255daaeabd942:4"> on the production tab. This time I'm going to name my app </span>`next-app-prod`<span offset-key="9ca5378361774ae98f9255daaeabd942:6"> (only because </span>`next-app`<span offset-key="9ca5378361774ae98f9255daaeabd942:8"> wasn't available, go figure) and then </span>`Create App`<span offset-key="9ca5378361774ae98f9255daaeabd942:10">.production pipeline added</span></span>

<span key="e5b3c6999fd54103a487ab19d9c8bf6c"><span offset-key="e5b3c6999fd54103a487ab19d9c8bf6c:0">Since everything looked good on our staging app, we are going to go ahead and click the </span>`Promote to production`<span offset-key="e5b3c6999fd54103a487ab19d9c8bf6c:2"> button and then </span>`Promote`<span offset-key="e5b3c6999fd54103a487ab19d9c8bf6c:4">. Changes should be promoted very quickly and then we can click on </span>`Open app`<span offset-key="e5b3c6999fd54103a487ab19d9c8bf6c:6"> on our production app we just created and see our site.production website</span></span>

# 

<span key="2fe6346068a547b9bcf0c8aa3cc7db3b"><span offset-key="2fe6346068a547b9bcf0c8aa3cc7db3b:0">Conclusion</span></span>

<span key="cdfb1d7febdd43ec91cc10683f01f981"><span offset-key="cdfb1d7febdd43ec91cc10683f01f981:0">We did it! Notice the URL here. This is our production URL now. If you bought a custom domain, you want to go into the settings tab in your production app and you can manage your domain name from there. If you have bought a secure domain with SLL (which you totally should) you will have to upgrade you subscript from free to hobby ($7 bucks a month) for heroku to manage your SLL cert for you. Which is totally worth it in my opinion. Another amazing feature the pipeline has is that it's already set up so that if you make any pull requests to the master branch it will create a preview for that pull request that you will be able to see in the </span>`Review Apps`<span offset-key="cdfb1d7febdd43ec91cc10683f01f981:2"> section of your pipeline, so you can check every branch before it gets merged to master. Once it gets pushed to master, it will build and redeploy your staging app. If everything still looks and works the way it should, all you have to do is promote it to production and you are ready to rock and roll!rock and roll</span></span>

# 

<span key="f52fdda6c69e47a5800d3e6880d9da4e"><span offset-key="f52fdda6c69e47a5800d3e6880d9da4e:0">Heroku Review Apps</span></span>

# 

<span key="ca120b7ed51c4e85aaa610ab51300fa5"><span offset-key="ca120b7ed51c4e85aaa610ab51300fa5:0">Objective</span></span>

<span key="db90323b57a8423292dd104eb37e6e94"><span offset-key="db90323b57a8423292dd104eb37e6e94:0">The Review Apps Heroku Pipeline would allow one not to have to use the Heroku remote to push to the staging server on Heroku. Overall, this should allow one to increase workload capacity since the Review Apps Pipeline could cut out the learning curve of deploying to Heroku via the Heroku remote through the CLI.</span></span>

<span key="5d289b42a12a4da89d9fde902adf6c16"><span offset-key="5d289b42a12a4da89d9fde902adf6c16:0">Heroku deploys the HEAD commit of the branch that the associated Pull Request is created on. When the branch is updated Heroku redeploys to the connected repo on the Review Apps Pipeline with your latest commit.</span></span>

<span key="066047594fb646a4b0f85f00079acdcd"><span offset-key="066047594fb646a4b0f85f00079acdcd:0">In summary, this guide will help you have a better understanding of what Review Apps on Heroku does and how to set it up for your GitHub repo.</span></span>

## 

<span key="7b78a46916f14c5c8094b9f857f0bb6c"><span offset-key="7b78a46916f14c5c8094b9f857f0bb6c:0">Setting Up Review Apps Steps</span></span>

<span key="85909216557142eab30d8528c886d7a3"><span offset-key="85909216557142eab30d8528c886d7a3:0">1.Create a Pipeline by going to your Heroku dashboard, going to </span>`new`<span offset-key="85909216557142eab30d8528c886d7a3:2">, clicking the dropdown, and clicking on </span>`create new Pipeline`<span offset-key="85909216557142eab30d8528c886d7a3:4">create new pipeline</span></span>

<span key="420363a8c3d0488f9526678592a3e5b9"><span offset-key="420363a8c3d0488f9526678592a3e5b9:0">2.Make sure to add the repo you want to connect the Review Apps Pipeline toconnect repo to pipeline</span></span>

<span key="7c083fdd970d4d9d93fa739932a02c9d"><span offset-key="7c083fdd970d4d9d93fa739932a02c9d:0">3.Once on the Pipeline Dashboard click </span>`Enable Review Apps`<span offset-key="7c083fdd970d4d9d93fa739932a02c9d:2">enable review apps</span></span>

<span key="cab630854da84461b879638172213673"><span offset-key="cab630854da84461b879638172213673:0">4.Then config Reviews Apps with your preferred settings</span></span>
